intro: Phyllanthus kouaouaensis, commonly known as the Kouaouaensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. It produces a milky sap that is a common feature of the genus Phyllanthus. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
